meanings.definition: In a way that is in proportion or in relation to something else.
meanings.sent1: She divided the candies proportionately among the children.
meanings.sent2: The ingredients in the recipe need to be added proportionately.
meanings.sent3: The clown juggled the balls proportionately, making sure not to drop any.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was spread proportionately, touching the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The colors in the painting were mixed proportionately, creating a harmonious blend.

meanings.definition: In a manner that maintains a consistent ratio or relationship.
meanings.sent1: The prices of the products increased proportionately with demand.
meanings.sent2: The sizes of the boxes were adjusted proportionately to fit the items.
meanings.sent3: The students' excitement grew proportionately as the field trip approached.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was reflected proportionately in his success.
meanings.sent5: The music volume rose proportionately with the energy of the crowd.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is appropriate or suitable in relation to something else.
meanings.sent1: She dressed proportionately for the formal event.
meanings.sent2: The team members contributed proportionately to the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat purred proportionately as its owner petted it gently.
meanings.sent4: His words were spoken proportionately to the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed proportionately to the amount of sunlight they received.
